entries.meaning: A plot made in opposition to another; a counterploy.

verbs.description: counterplot (third-person singular simple present counterplots, present participle counterplotting, simple past and past participle counterplotted)

entries.meaning: (intransitive, transitive) To form a plot or plan in opposition to the actions of another.
examples: Every wile had proved abortive, every plot had been counterplotted.
